label: 勧学田
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Tax free rice fields (fuyusoden) that were given to the Bureau of Education (Daigakuryō ), Bureau of Medicine (Ten'yakuryō ), and the Kan-gakuin to be used for the support of students, in order that learning might be encouraged. [不輸租田、大学寮、典薬寮、勧学院]
